Punjab.BasicInfo: Punjabi cuisine is rich, robust, and full of flavor. It heavily uses dairy (like butter, cream, paneer), whole wheat, pulses, and spices. Tandoori cooking, slow simmering, and hearty meals are the soul of Punjabi food. Common accompaniments include pickles, curd, lassi, and makhan (butter).

Dishes.Name: Sarson Da Saag
Dishes.BasicInfo: A winter favorite, made from mustard greens, spinach, and bathua (goosefoot). Traditionally served with Makki di Roti.
Steps: Temper with ghee and serve with Makki di Roti.

Dishes.Name: Dal Makhani
Dishes.BasicInfo: A creamy black lentil curry made with urad dal and kidney beans, simmered overnight for depth and richness.
Ingredients: Spices – cumin, garam masala, red chili
Steps: Finish with cream and extra butter.

Dishes.Name: Butter Chicken
Dishes.BasicInfo: The iconic creamy chicken curry cooked in a tomato-butter gravy with aromatic spices.
Ingredients: Spices – garam masala, kasuri methi, chili powder
Steps: Stir in cream and kasuri methi.
HealthBenefits: Rich in B vitamins from meat

Dishes.Name: Chole Bhature
Dishes.BasicInfo: A popular dish combining spicy chickpeas (chole) with fluffy fried bread (bhature).
Steps: Roll into bhature and deep fry.

Dishes.Name: Rajma Chawal
Dishes.BasicInfo: Kidney beans cooked in a thick gravy, usually served with rice.
Steps: Cook rice separately and serve together.

Dishes.Name: Lassi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A traditional yogurt-based drink, can be sweet or savory.
Steps: Serve chilled.

Dishes.Name: Amritsari Fish
Dishes.BasicInfo: Crispy and spicy deep-fried fish, a specialty from Amritsar.
Steps: Deep fry until golden and crispy.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Paratha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Whole wheat flatbread stuffed with spiced mashed potatoes.
Steps: Cook on tawa with ghee until golden.

Dishes.Name: Paneer Tikka
Dishes.BasicInfo: Marinated and grilled or baked paneer (Indian cheese) cubes.
Steps: Serve hot with mint chutney.

Dishes.Name: Pinni
Dishes.BasicInfo: A traditional Punjabi sweet made from wheat flour, ghee, and nuts.
Steps: Add nuts and cardamom, shape into balls.

Himachal Pradesh.BasicInfo: Himachali cuisine is earthy, hearty, and slow-cooked, often prepared during festivals and communal gatherings. It focuses on warmth, digestibility, and nutrition to suit the cool mountainous climate, using lentils, meats, dairy, and native grains.

Dishes.Name: Chana Madra
Dishes.BasicInfo: A creamy, yogurt-based curry made with chickpeas and native spices—an essential part of the Chamba dham (traditional feast).
Ingredients: Cumin, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves – whole spices
Steps: Boil chickpeas until soft.
In ghee, temper cumin seeds with hing.
Slowly mix in yogurt, stirring constantly.
Add besan with all the spices and roast till aromatic.
Add chickpeas and simmer for 15–20 mins.
Adjust salt and garnish with coriander.

Dishes.Name: Dham
Dishes.BasicInfo: A traditional festive meal, usually includes rice, dal (lentils), rajma (kidney beans), and a yogurt-based curry like Madra.
Steps: Cook rice separately.
Boil dal and rajma until soft.
Prepare a yogurt-based curry with spices and ghee.
Serve all components together.
HealthBenefits: Balanced meal with protein and carbs

Dishes.Name: Siddu
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed bread made from wheat flour, stuffed with either mashed potatoes or poppy seeds.
Steps: Prepare dough with flour and yeast, let it rise.
Mix mashed potatoes with spices.
Stuff dough, shape into buns.
Steam for 20 mins, serve with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Tudkiya Bhaat
Dishes.BasicInfo: A unique pulao made with rice, lentils, and vegetables, cooked with aromatic spices.
Steps: Soak dal for 30 mins.
Sauté spices in ghee, add vegetables.
Add rice and dal, cook with water until done.

Dishes.Name: Bhey
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy lotus stem curry, a popular dish in the Himachal region.
Steps: Boil lotus stems until tender.
Sauté ginger-garlic and spices in oil.
Add tomatoes and lotus stems, cook for 15 mins.

Dishes.Name: Chha Gosht
Dishes.BasicInfo: A flavorful lamb curry cooked in yogurt and gram flour.
Steps: Marinate lamb with yogurt and spices for 1 hour.
Cook in ghee with gram flour until thick.
Simmer until lamb is tender.

Dishes.Name: Khatta
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sour dish made from raw mangoes or dried mango powder.
Steps: Cook mango with water until soft.
Temper spices in oil, add mango and jaggery.
Simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Palda
Dishes.BasicInfo: A creamy potato curry made with yogurt and spices.
Steps: Boil potatoes until tender.
Sauté spices in ghee, add yogurt.
Add potatoes, simmer for 10 mins.

Dishes.Name: Babru
Dishes.BasicInfo: A type of fried bread made from soaked and ground black gram.
Steps: Grind soaked gram into batter.
Add spices and salt.
Deep fry spoonfuls until golden.

Dishes.Name: Aktori
Dishes.BasicInfo: A type of pancake or bread made from buckwheat flour.
Steps: Mix flour with water and spices into batter.
Cook on tawa with ghee like pancakes.

Haryana.BasicInfo: Haryanvi cuisine is simple, rustic, and nutritious, reflecting the agricultural lifestyle of the region. It uses millets, dairy, and seasonal vegetables extensively.

Dishes.Name: Bajra Khichdi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A wholesome dish made from pearl millet and lentils.
Steps: Soak bajra overnight, grind coarsely.
Cook with moong dal and water until soft.
Temper with ghee and spices.

Dishes.Name: Kachri Ki Sabzi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A tangy dish made from wild cucumber (kachri).
Steps: Grind kachri into paste.
Sauté with spices in oil.
Cook until thick.

Dishes.Name: Singri Ki Sabzi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A dry vegetable dish made from dried beans.
Steps: Boil singri until tender.
Sauté with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Meethe Chawal
Dishes.BasicInfo: Sweet rice flavored with saffron and nuts.
Steps: Cook rice with saffron.
Melt sugar in ghee, add rice and nuts.
Mix well and serve.

Dishes.Name: Kadhi Pakora
Dishes.BasicInfo: A yogurt-based curry with gram flour fritters.
Steps: Make pakoras with gram flour batter, fry.
Cook yogurt with spices and water.
Add pakoras, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Puri
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spiced potato curry served with deep-fried bread.
Steps: Cook potatoes with spices.
Knead flour, roll into puris, fry.
Serve together.

Dishes.Name: Gajar Ka Halwa
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet carrot pudding with ghee and nuts.
Steps: Cook carrots in milk until soft.
Add sugar and ghee, cook until thick.
Garnish with nuts.

Dishes.Name: Thandai
Dishes.BasicInfo: A spiced milk drink served chilled.
Steps: Blend spices and nuts with milk.
Add sugar and saffron, chill.
Serve cold.

Dishes.Name: Besan Masala Roti
Steps: Knead flour with spices and water.
Roll out and cook with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Paneer Korma
Dishes.BasicInfo: A creamy paneer curry with nuts and spices.
Steps: Sauté spices and nuts in oil.
Add cream and paneer, simmer.

Uttarakhand.BasicInfo: Uttarakhandi cuisine is wholesome and simple, designed for the mountainous terrain. It uses local grains, lentils, and greens extensively.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Ke Gutke
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spiced potato dish, a popular snack.
Steps: Boil potatoes lightly.
Sauté with spices in oil until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Kafuli
Dishes.BasicInfo: A thick green curry made from spinach and fenugreek.
Steps: Boil greens, blend coarsely.
Cook with rice flour and spices in ghee.

Dishes.Name: Mysore Pak
Dishes.BasicInfo: A rich gram flour and ghee sweet.
Steps: Roast gram flour in ghee.
Add sugar syrup, stir until thick, set.

Dishes.Name: Neer Dosa
Dishes.BasicInfo: Thin, soft rice crepes from coastal Karnataka.
Steps: Soak rice, grind with coconut into batter.
Cook thin crepes on a tawa.

Dishes.Name: Chicken Ghee Roast
Dishes.BasicInfo: A spicy, ghee-roasted chicken dish from Mangalore.
Steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Roast in ghee until golden.

Dishes.Name: Akki Roti
Steps: Mix rice flour with spices and onion.
Pat into flatbreads, cook on tawa.

Dishes.Name: Kori Rotti
Dishes.BasicInfo: Crispy rice wafers with chicken curry.
Steps: Cook chicken with coconut and spices.
Serve over crisp rottis.

Dishes.Name: Obbattu
Dishes.BasicInfo: Sweet flatbread stuffed with lentils and jaggery.
Steps: Cook dal with jaggery, stuff in dough.
Roll out, cook with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Maddur Vada
Dishes.BasicInfo: A crispy fried snack with rice flour and onions.
Steps: Mix flour with onions and spices.
Shape into patties, deep fry.

Dishes.Name: Kesari Bath
Steps: Roast semolina in ghee.
Add sugar syrup and saffron, cook until thick.

Telangana.BasicInfo: Telangana cuisine is known for its spicy and tangy flavors, with rice, millets, and meat dishes featuring prominently.

Dishes.Name: Hyderabadi Biryani
Dishes.BasicInfo: A fragrant rice and meat dish with spices.
Steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Layer with parboiled rice, cook on low heat.

Dishes.Name: Pachi Pulusu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A raw tamarind rasam, no cooking required.
Steps: Soak tamarind in water, strain.
Mix with onions and spices, serve cold.

Dishes.Name: Sarva Pindi
Steps: Mix rice flour with peanuts and spices.
Pat into flatbread, cook on tawa.

Dishes.Name: Golichina Mamsam
Dishes.BasicInfo: A spicy mutton fry with Telangana spices.
Steps: Marinate mutton with spices.
Fry until crispy and tender.

Dishes.Name: Qubani ka Meetha
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet apricot dessert with custard.
Steps: Soak apricots, cook with sugar.
Serve with custard and nuts.

Dishes.Name: Jonna Rotte
Steps: Knead jowar flour with water.
Pat into flatbreads, cook on tawa.

Dishes.Name: Bagara Baingan
Dishes.BasicInfo: Eggplants in a peanut and sesame gravy.
Steps: Roast peanuts and sesame, grind into paste.
Cook eggplants in spiced gravy.

Dishes.Name: Pappu Charu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A tangy lentil soup with tamarind.
Steps: Cook dal with spices.
Add tamarind water, temper.

Dishes.Name: Sakinalu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A crispy rice flour snack for festivals.
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and spices.
Shape into rings, deep fry.

Dishes.Name: Double ka Meetha
Dishes.BasicInfo: A bread pudding with milk and nuts.
Steps: Fry bread in ghee, soak in sugar syrup.
Top with thickened milk and nuts.

Andhra Pradesh.BasicInfo: Andhra cuisine is fiery and tangy, known for its chutneys, pickles, and liberal use of chilies and tamarind.

Dishes.Name: Gongura Pachadi
Steps: Sauté gongura leaves with chilies.
Grind with spices, temper.

Dishes.Name: Pesarattu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A green gram crepe, often served with chutney.
Steps: Soak dal, grind with chilies and ginger.
Cook thin crepes on tawa.

Dishes.Name: Pulihora
Dishes.BasicInfo: Tamarind rice with spices and peanuts.
Steps: Cook rice, mix with tamarind paste.
Temper with peanuts and spices.

Dishes.Name: Andhra Chicken Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: A fiery chicken dish with local spices.
Steps: Cook chicken with spices and coconut.
Simmer until thick and tender.

Dishes.Name: Ariselu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet rice flour and jaggery snack.
Steps: Make jaggery syrup, mix with rice flour.
Shape into discs, fry.

Dishes.Name: Gutti Vankaya
Dishes.BasicInfo: Stuffed eggplants in a spicy gravy.
Steps: Stuff eggplants with roasted peanut mix.
Cook in spiced gravy.

Dishes.Name: Kodi Kura
Dishes.BasicInfo: A spicy chicken curry with Andhra flavors.
Steps: Sauté onions and spices, add chicken.
Cook until tender and spicy.

Dishes.Name: Pappu Pulusu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A lentil and vegetable stew with tamarind.
Steps: Cook dal with vegetables.
Add tamarind and spices, temper.

Dishes.Name: Chepala Pulusu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A tangy fish curry with tamarind.
Steps: Cook fish with tamarind and spices.
Simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Pootharekulu
Dishes.BasicInfo: A delicate rice paper sweet with ghee and jaggery.
Steps: Make thin rice sheets.
Layer with jaggery and nuts, fold.

Odisha.BasicInfo: Odia cuisine is subtle yet flavorful, using rice, lentils, and vegetables, with minimal oil and a focus on temple food traditions.

Dishes.Name: Dalma
Dishes.BasicInfo: A lentil and vegetable stew with coconut.
Steps: Cook dal with vegetables.
Add coconut and spices, temper with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Pakhala Bhata
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fermented rice soaked in water, a summer dish.
Steps: Soak cooked rice in water overnight.
Mix with yogurt, serve cold.

Dishes.Name: Chhena Poda
Steps: Mix chhena with sugar and semolina.
Bake until golden and firm.

Dishes.Name: Santula
Dishes.BasicInfo: A light vegetable stew with minimal spices.
Steps: Boil vegetables with spices.
Temper with cumin.

Dishes.Name: Machha Besara
Steps: Grind mustard with spices into a paste.
Cook fish in mustard gravy.

Dishes.Name: Dahi Baigana
Steps: Fry eggplant slices.
Mix with spiced yogurt.

Dishes.Name: Rasabali
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fried chhena patties in sweetened milk.
Steps: Shape chhena into patties, fry.
Soak in thickened sweet milk.

Dishes.Name: Khechidi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A simple rice and lentil dish, temple-style.
Steps: Cook rice and dal together.
Temper with ghee and cumin.

Dishes.Name: Poda Pitha
Dishes.BasicInfo: A baked rice cake with coconut and jaggery.
Steps: Mix rice flour with coconut and jaggery.
Bake until firm and golden.

Dishes.Name: Badi Chura
Dishes.BasicInfo: A crunchy side dish made from dried lentil dumplings.
Steps: Fry badis until crispy.
Crush and temper with spices.

Jharkhand.BasicInfo: Jharkhandi cuisine reflects tribal influences with simple, rustic dishes made from local grains, greens, and meats.

Dishes.Name: Dhuska
Dishes.BasicInfo: A deep-fried rice and lentil pancake.
Steps: Soak rice and dal, grind into a batter.
Add spices and salt to the batter.
Fry spoonfuls in hot oil until golden.

Dishes.Name: Litti Chokha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Roasted wheat balls with mashed vegetables.
Steps: Knead dough, stuff with spiced sattu, roast.
Mash boiled vegetables with spices and ghee.

Dishes.Name: Chilka Roti
Dishes.BasicInfo: A thin rice and lentil crepe.
Steps: Soak rice and dal, grind into a batter.
Spread batter on a hot tawa, cook until crisp.

Dishes.Name: Pitha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed rice dumplings with sweet or savory filling.
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and water.
Fill with coconut and jaggery, steam.

Dishes.Name: Handia
Steps: Cook rice, cool, mix with ranu.
Ferment for 3-5 days, strain.

Dishes.Name: Thekua
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet fried snack made with wheat flour.
Steps: Knead dough with melted jaggery and ghee.
Shape into discs, fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Rugra Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: A curry made with wild mushrooms.
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add cleaned mushrooms, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Malpua
Steps: Make batter with flour and milk.
Fry pancakes, soak in sugar syrup.

Dishes.Name: Arsa
Steps: Make batter with rice flour and melted jaggery.
Fry spoonfuls until golden.

Dishes.Name: Mutton Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: A spicy mutton dish with local spices.
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add mutton, cook until tender.

Chhattisgarh.BasicInfo: Chhattisgarhi cuisine uses rice, lentils, and forest produce, with a focus on simple, wholesome dishes influenced by tribal traditions.

Dishes.Name: Bore Basi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fermented rice with curd or buttermilk.
Steps: Soak cooked rice in water overnight.
Mix with curd, chilies, and salt.

Dishes.Name: Chila
Steps: Mix rice flour with water, spices, and salt.
Spread batter on a hot tawa, cook until crisp.

Dishes.Name: Fara
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and water.
Shape into dumplings, steam until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Dehati Bada
Steps: Soak dal, grind with spices.
Mix with onions, fry spoonfuls until golden.

Dishes.Name: Muthia
Steps: Mix rice flour with vegetables and spices.
Shape into rolls, steam until firm.

Dishes.Name: Aamat
Dishes.BasicInfo: A tangy vegetable and lentil stew.
Steps: Cook dal and vegetables with salt.
Add tamarind, temper with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Thethri
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and melted jaggery.
Shape into small pieces, fry until crisp.

Dishes.Name: Bafauri
Steps: Soak dal, grind with spices and salt.
Steam batter in molds until firm.

Dishes.Name: Petha Sabzi
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add chopped pumpkin, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Angakar Roti
Dishes.BasicInfo: A rice flour flatbread cooked over embers.
Steps: Knead rice flour with water and salt.
Cook on a tawa or over embers.

Bihar.BasicInfo: Bihari cuisine is hearty and rustic, featuring staples like rice, lentils, and grilled meats with minimal spices.

Dishes.Name: Litti Chokha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Roasted wheat balls with mashed vegetables.
Steps: Knead dough, stuff with spiced sattu, roast.
Mash grilled vegetables with spices and ghee.

Dishes.Name: Sattu Paratha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Flatbread stuffed with roasted gram flour.
Steps: Knead dough with wheat flour.
Stuff with spiced sattu, roll, and cook with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Chana Ghugni
Steps: Boil chickpeas until soft.
Sauté onions and spices, add chickpeas, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Thekua
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet fried snack made with wheat flour.
Steps: Knead dough with melted jaggery and ghee.
Shape into discs, fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Khichdi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A one-pot rice and lentil dish.
Steps: Cook rice and dal with spices and salt.
Temper with ghee and cumin.

Dishes.Name: Makuni
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and water.
Shape into dumplings, steam.

Dishes.Name: Bihari Kebab
Steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt and spices.
Skewer and grill until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Malpua
Steps: Make batter with flour and milk.
Fry pancakes, soak in sugar syrup.

Dishes.Name: Dal Pitha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed rice dumplings with lentil filling.
Steps: Cook and mash dal with spices.
Make dough with rice flour, stuff with dal, steam.

Dishes.Name: Parwal Ki Mithai
Dishes.BasicInfo: A sweet made from pointed gourd.
Steps: Peel and stuff parwal with milk solids.
Cook in sugar syrup until tender.

Uttar Pradesh.BasicInfo: Uttar Pradeshi cuisine blends Mughal influences with local flavors, featuring rich curries, breads, and sweets.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Kachori
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fried bread stuffed with spiced potatoes.
Steps: Knead dough with flour and water.
Stuff with mashed spiced potatoes, fry.

Dishes.Name: Lucknowi Biryani
Dishes.BasicInfo: A fragrant rice and meat dish.
Steps: Marinate mutton with spices.
Layer with parboiled rice, cook on low heat.

Dishes.Name: Tunday Kebab
Steps: Mix meat with spices, shape into patties.
Cook in ghee until golden.

Dishes.Name: Peda
Steps: Reduce milk to solids with sugar.
Shape into discs, sprinkle cardamom.

Dishes.Name: Paneer Pasanda
Dishes.BasicInfo: Paneer in a rich creamy gravy.
Steps: Fry paneer cubes lightly.
Cook spices and cream into a gravy, add paneer.

Dishes.Name: Korma
Dishes.BasicInfo: A rich meat curry with nuts and yogurt.
Steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt and spices.
Cook with ground almonds until tender.

Dishes.Name: Mathura Ke Ladoo
Dishes.BasicInfo: Sweet balls made from gram flour.
Steps: Roast besan in ghee, add sugar syrup.
Shape into balls when cool.

Dishes.Name: Baati
Dishes.BasicInfo: Baked wheat balls served with dal.
Steps: Knead dough with ghee and salt.
Shape into balls, bake until golden.

Dishes.Name: Shahi Tukda
Steps: Fry bread slices in ghee.
Soak in sweetened milk, garnish with nuts.

Dishes.Name: Bedmi Puri
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fried bread made with spiced lentils.
Steps: Grind soaked dal with spices.
Knead into dough with flour, fry.

West Bengal.BasicInfo: Bengali cuisine is known for its delicate balance of sweet and savory, with a strong emphasis on fish, rice, and mustard-based dishes, alongside rich desserts.

Dishes.Name: Shorshe Ilish
Dishes.BasicInfo: Hilsa fish cooked in mustard sauce.
Steps: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt.
Sauté mustard paste and spices in oil.
Add fish and chilies, simmer until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Bhapa Ilish
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed hilsa with mustard and coconut.
Steps: Coat fish with mustard, coconut, and spices.
Wrap in banana leaf, steam for 15 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Cholar Dal
Steps: Cook chana dal until soft.
Temper with spices and ghee, add coconut.

Dishes.Name: Luchi
Steps: Knead maida with salt and water into a dough.
Roll into small discs, deep fry until puffed.

Dishes.Name: Rasgulla
Dishes.BasicInfo: Soft chhena balls in sugar syrup.
Steps: Knead chhena into balls.
Boil in sugar syrup until doubled in size.

Dishes.Name: Mishti Doi
Steps: Reduce milk with sugar, cool slightly.
Add curd, ferment overnight.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Posto
Dishes.BasicInfo: Potatoes cooked with poppy seed paste.
Steps: Grind poppy seeds into a paste.
Sauté potatoes with paste and chilies in oil.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Malai Curry
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add prawns and coconut milk, simmer until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Sandesh
Steps: Knead chhena with sugar until smooth.
Shape into discs, chill.

Dishes.Name: Bhetki Macher Paturi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Bhetki fish wrapped in banana leaf with spices.
Steps: Coat fish with mustard, coconut, and spices.
Wrap in banana leaves, steam or grill.

Assam.BasicInfo: Assamese cuisine is light and tangy, with minimal spices, featuring rice, fish, and unique herbs like bhut jolokia and banana flowers.

Dishes.Name: Masor Tenga
Steps: Fry fish lightly in oil.
Sauté tomatoes and spices, add water.
Add fish and lemon juice, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Pitika
Dishes.BasicInfo: Mashed potatoes with mustard oil and herbs.
Steps: Mash boiled potatoes with oil and salt.
Mix in chilies and onions.

Dishes.Name: Pitha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice flour pancakes with sweet filling.
Steps: Make batter with rice flour and water.
Fill with coconut and jaggery, cook as pancakes.

Dishes.Name: Khar
Dishes.BasicInfo: A dish with raw papaya and alkaline khar.
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add papaya and khar, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Duck Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy duck cooked with local spices.
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add duck, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Bamboo Shoot Fry
Steps: Boil bamboo shoots to remove bitterness.
Sauté with onions and spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Ou Tenga
Steps: Cook dal until soft.
Add elephant apple and spices, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Jolpan
Dishes.BasicInfo: A breakfast dish with puffed rice and curd.
Steps: Mix puffed rice with curd and jaggery.
Top with banana slices.

Dishes.Name: Pork with Bhut Jolokia
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy pork curry with ghost chili.
Steps: Sauté spices and chili in oil.
Add pork, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Narasingha Tenga
Dishes.BasicInfo: Curry with curry leaves and tamarind.
Steps: Sauté spices and curry leaves in oil.
Add tamarind paste and water, simmer.

Arunachal Pradesh.BasicInfo: Arunachali cuisine is simple and organic, using local herbs, bamboo, and meats, with minimal spices and a focus on smoked and boiled dishes.

Dishes.Name: Smoked Pork with Bamboo Shoot
Dishes.BasicInfo: Pork cooked with bamboo shoots and local herbs.
Steps: Boil bamboo shoots to remove bitterness.
Cook pork with shoots, ginger, and chili.

Dishes.Name: Pika Pila
Dishes.BasicInfo: A tangy pickle with chili and herbs.
Steps: Chop chilies and mix with ginger and salt.
Add lemon juice, store in a jar.

Dishes.Name: Apong
Steps: Cook rice, cool, mix with yeast.
Ferment for 5-7 days, strain.

Dishes.Name: Lukter
Steps: Soak dried meat to soften.
Stir-fry with spices and oil.

Dishes.Name: Bamboo Shoot Soup
Dishes.BasicInfo: Light soup with bamboo shoots and herbs.
Steps: Boil bamboo shoots with ginger and chilies.
Season with salt, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Mung Dal with Herbs
Steps: Cook mung dal until soft.
Add greens and spices, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Zan
Steps: Boil water, add millet flour gradually.
Stir until thick, season with salt.

Dishes.Name: Chicken with Ginger
Dishes.BasicInfo: Chicken cooked with ginger and local spices.
Steps: Sauté ginger and spices in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Oying
Steps: Sauté ginger and spices in oil.
Add vegetables, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Peha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice flour pancakes with savory filling.
Steps: Make batter with rice flour and water.
Fill with cooked minced meat, cook as pancakes.

Nagaland.BasicInfo: Naga cuisine is bold and spicy, using fermented ingredients, bamboo, and meats, with bhut jolokia adding intense heat.

Dishes.Name: Pork with Bamboo Shoot
Dishes.BasicInfo: Pork curry with fermented bamboo shoots.
Steps: Cook pork with spices in oil.
Add bamboo shoot, simmer until tender.

Dishes.Name: Axone Curry
Steps: Sauté axone and spices in oil.
Add pork, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Naga Chicken Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: Chicken with bhut jolokia and herbs.
Steps: Sauté spices and chili in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Anishi
Steps: Boil yam leaves, mash with spices.
Shape into cakes, ferment for 2 days.

Dishes.Name: Smoked Fish Chutney
Steps: Flake smoked fish, mix with chopped chilies and ginger.
Season with salt.

Dishes.Name: Galho
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice and vegetable soup with meat.
Steps: Cook rice and pork with water.
Add vegetables and spices, simmer.

Dishes.Name: King Chili Chutney
Steps: Grind chilies and garlic with salt.
Mix with oil, serve.

Dishes.Name: Naga Bamboo Rice
Steps: Fill bamboo tube with rice and water.
Seal and cook over fire until done.

Dishes.Name: Rosep Aon
Steps: Boil taro leaves, ferment for 2 days.
Cook with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Smoked Beef Curry
Steps: Smoke beef lightly.
Cook with spices in oil until tender.

Manipur.BasicInfo: Manipuri cuisine is fresh and light, using rice, fish, and local greens, with dishes often steamed or boiled for health benefits.

Dishes.Name: Eromba
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy mashed vegetable and fish dish.
Steps: Mash boiled potatoes with fermented fish.
Mix with chilies and spices.

Dishes.Name: Chak-hao Kheer
Steps: Cook black rice in milk until soft.
Add sugar and cardamom, stir until thick.

Dishes.Name: Singju
Steps: Mix cabbage, chilies, and fermented fish.
Garnish with coriander, season with salt.

Dishes.Name: Kangshoi
Dishes.BasicInfo: A light vegetable and fish stew.
Steps: Boil vegetables and fish with spices.
Season with salt, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Ooti
Steps: Soak peas, cook until soft.
Sauté potatoes and spices, add peas.

Dishes.Name: Chamthong
Steps: Cook mung dal until soft.
Add vegetables and spices, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Morok Metpa
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy chili and fermented fish chutney.
Steps: Roast chilies, mash with fermented fish.
Mix with onions and salt.

Dishes.Name: Manipuri Fish Curry
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add fish, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Iromba
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fermented bamboo shoot and fish chutney.
Steps: Mash bamboo shoot with fish and chilies.
Season with salt.

Dishes.Name: Ngari Salad
Dishes.BasicInfo: Salad with fermented fish and herbs.
Steps: Mix ngari with cucumber and chilies.
Garnish with coriander, season.

Mizoram.BasicInfo: Mizo cuisine is light, healthy, and minimally spiced, featuring boiled or steamed dishes with local greens, bamboo shoots, and meats.

Dishes.Name: Bai
Dishes.BasicInfo: A vegetable and meat stew with herbs.
Steps: Boil pork with ginger and salt.
Add vegetables and bamboo shoot, simmer until tender.

Dishes.Name: Vawksa Rep
Steps: Smoke pork over fire.
Sauté with spices in oil until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Misa Mach Poora
Dishes.BasicInfo: Grilled shrimp wrapped in banana leaf.
Steps: Marinate shrimp with spices and oil.
Wrap in banana leaves, grill for 10 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Chhum Han
Steps: Chop vegetables, mix with spices.
Steam until tender.

Dishes.Name: Zu
Steps: Cook rice, cool, mix with yeast.
Ferment for 5-7 days, strain.

Dishes.Name: Panch Phoran Tarkari
Steps: Sauté panch phoran and spices in oil.
Add vegetables, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Sawhchiar
Steps: Cook rice and chicken with water.
Add spices, simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Bamboo Shoot Fry
Steps: Boil bamboo shoots to remove bitterness.
Stir-fry with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Koat Pitha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fried rice flour dumplings with banana.
Steps: Mix rice flour, banana, and sugar into a dough.
Shape into dumplings, fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Mizo Dal
Steps: Cook dal until soft.
Add greens and spices, simmer.

Tripura.BasicInfo: Tripuri cuisine is simple and tangy, using rice, fish, and fermented ingredients, with a focus on local greens and minimal spices.

Dishes.Name: Mui Borok
Steps: Boil fish with spices and salt.
Add vegetables and bamboo shoot, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Wahan Mosdeng
Steps: Cook pork with spices.
Mash with chilies and oil.

Dishes.Name: Gudok
Steps: Boil vegetables with spices.
Add fermented fish, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Awan Bangwi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed rice cake wrapped in leaves.
Steps: Mix rice flour with coconut and water.
Wrap in banana leaves, steam.

Dishes.Name: Berma Bwtwi
Steps: Mash fermented fish with chilies and ginger.
Season with salt.

Dishes.Name: Chakhwi
Steps: Boil bamboo shoot to remove bitterness.
Sauté vegetables and spices, add bamboo.

Dishes.Name: Mosdeng Serma
Steps: Cook chicken with spices.
Mash with chilies and oil.

Dishes.Name: Muitru
Steps: Cook rice and fish with water.
Add spices, simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Pork with Bamboo Shoot
Steps: Boil bamboo shoot to remove bitterness.
Cook pork with spices and bamboo.

Dishes.Name: Chakoi
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add greens, cook until soft.

Meghalaya.BasicInfo: Meghalayan cuisine is rustic and flavorful, using rice, meats, and local spices like black sesame and Khasi pepper.

Dishes.Name: Jadoh
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice cooked with pork and spices.
Steps: Sauté pork with spices in oil.
Add rice and water, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Dohkhlieh
Dishes.BasicInfo: Pork salad with onions and chilies.
Steps: Chop boiled pork finely.
Mix with onions, chilies, and ginger.

Dishes.Name: Nakham Bitchi
Steps: Soak dried fish to soften.
Boil with spices and water.

Dishes.Name: Pumaloi
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and water.
Shape into dumplings, steam.

Dishes.Name: Dohneiiong
Steps: Sauté spices and sesame paste in oil.
Add pork, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Tungrymbai
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add soybeans, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Kyat
Steps: Cook rice, cool, mix with yeast.
Ferment for 5-7 days, strain.

Dishes.Name: Pukhlein
Steps: Mix rice flour with melted jaggery.
Fry spoonfuls until golden.

Dishes.Name: Dohjem
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Bamboo Shoot Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: Curry with bamboo shoots and spices.
Steps: Boil bamboo shoot to remove bitterness.
Sauté with spices in oil.

Sikkim.BasicInfo: Sikkimese cuisine is influenced by Tibetan and Nepali flavors, featuring fermented foods, noodles, and hearty meat dishes.

Dishes.Name: Momo
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed dumplings with meat or vegetable filling.
Steps: Knead flour into dough, roll into circles.
Fill with meat and cabbage, steam.

Dishes.Name: Thukpa
Dishes.BasicInfo: Noodle soup with vegetables and meat.
Steps: Boil noodles, set aside.
Cook chicken and vegetables in spiced broth, add noodles.

Dishes.Name: Phagshapa
Dishes.BasicInfo: Pork curry with radish and chilies.
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add pork and radish, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Gundruk
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add gundruk, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Sael Roti
Steps: Mix rice flour with sugar and water into a batter.
Fry in rings until golden.

Dishes.Name: Chhurpi Soup
Steps: Boil vegetables with spices.
Add chhurpi, simmer until melted.

Dishes.Name: Kinema Curry
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add kinema, cook until soft.

Dishes.Name: Shyaphaley
Steps: Knead flour into dough, roll into circles.
Fill with meat, fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Chhang
Steps: Cook millet, cool, mix with yeast.
Ferment for 5-7 days, strain.

Dishes.Name: Mesu
Steps: Chop bamboo shoot, mix with spices.
Ferment for 7-10 days.

Andaman and Nicobar Islands.BasicInfo: Andamanese cuisine is seafood-centric, influenced by South Indian and tribal flavors, using coconut, spices, and tropical ingredients.

Dishes.Name: Fish Curry
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy fish curry with coconut milk.
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add fish and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Crab Masala
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add crab, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Prawn Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add prawns and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Tandoori Fish
Steps: Marinate fish with yogurt and spices.
Grill until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Banana Leaf Rice
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice served with seafood curries on banana leaf.
Steps: Cook rice, set aside.
Serve with curries on banana leaf.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Ladoo
Steps: Cook coconut with sugar and milk.
Shape into balls, sprinkle cardamom.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Fry
Steps: Coat prawns with spices and flour.
Deep fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Vegetable Thoran
Steps: Sauté spices and coconut in oil.
Add vegetables, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Squid Masala
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add squid, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Rice
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add rice and coconut milk, cook until done.

Gujarat.BasicInfo: Gujarati cuisine is predominantly vegetarian, balancing sweet, sour, and spicy flavors, with staples like dhokla, thepla, and kadhi.

Dishes.Name: Dhokla
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed fermented rice and chickpea cake.
Steps: Mix flours with yogurt, ferment overnight.
Steam batter, temper with spices.

Dishes.Name: Thepla
Steps: Knead flour with spices, leaves, and oil.
Roll into flatbreads, cook on griddle.

Dishes.Name: Kadhi
Steps: Mix yogurt and gram flour, cook with water.
Temper with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Undhiyu
Dishes.BasicInfo: Mixed vegetable curry with green beans.
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add vegetables, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Khandvi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rolled gram flour sheets with spices.
Steps: Cook gram flour and yogurt into a paste.
Spread thin, roll, temper with spices.

Dishes.Name: Shrikhand
Steps: Strain yogurt overnight.
Mix with sugar, cardamom, and saffron.

Dishes.Name: Fafda
Steps: Knead gram flour with spices and water.
Roll thin, fry until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Dabeli
Steps: Cook potatoes with spices.
Fill buns with potato mix and chutney.

Dishes.Name: Handvo
Steps: Ferment rice and dal batter overnight.
Mix with vegetables, bake with tempered spices.

Dishes.Name: Basundi
Steps: Simmer milk until thickened.
Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts.

Kerala.BasicInfo: Kerala cuisine is vibrant, using coconut, seafood, and spices, with rice-based dishes and tangy curries.

Dishes.Name: Sadya
Steps: Cook rice and dal separately.
Prepare avial, sambar, and rasam with spices.
Serve with chips on banana leaf.

Dishes.Name: Fish Molee
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add fish and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Appam
Steps: Ferment rice and coconut batter with yeast.
Cook in a curved pan until lacy.

Dishes.Name: Puttu
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed rice flour and coconut cylinder.
Steps: Mix rice flour with water and salt.
Layer with coconut, steam in a mold.

Dishes.Name: Kerala Prawn Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add prawns and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Avial
Steps: Cook vegetables with spices.
Mix with coconut and yogurt.

Dishes.Name: Idiyappam
Steps: Make dough with rice flour and water.
Press into noodles, steam.

Dishes.Name: Payasam
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rice or vermicelli pudding with jaggery.
Steps: Cook rice in coconut milk.
Add jaggery and cardamom, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Kerala Chicken Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add chicken and coconut milk, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Banana Chips
Steps: Slice bananas thinly.
Fry in oil with turmeric and salt.

Madhya Pradesh.BasicInfo: Madhya Pradesh cuisine is hearty, with influences from Malwa and Bundelkhand, featuring grains, lentils, and meat dishes.

Dishes.Name: Poha
Dishes.BasicInfo: Flattened rice with spices and onions.
Steps: Soak poha briefly, drain.
Sauté onions and spices, add poha.

Dishes.Name: Bhutte ka Kees
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add corn and milk, cook until thick.

Dishes.Name: Dal Bafla
Dishes.BasicInfo: Baked wheat balls with lentil curry.
Steps: Knead flour, bake balls.
Cook dal with spices, serve with bafla.

Dishes.Name: Mawa Bati
Steps: Knead flour, stuff with mawa and sugar.
Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Bhindi Masala
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add okra, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Malpua
Steps: Make batter with flour and milk.
Fry pancakes, soak in sugar syrup.

Dishes.Name: Keema
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add meat, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Chakki ki Shaak
Steps: Make dough, shape dumplings.
Cook in spiced yogurt gravy.

Dishes.Name: Sabudana Khichdi
Steps: Soak sabudana for 4 hours.
Sauté with peanuts and spices.

Dishes.Name: Khichda
Steps: Cook lentils and mutton with spices.
Simmer until thick, add ghee.

Maharashtra.BasicInfo: Maharashtrian cuisine is diverse, with coastal seafood, spicy curries, and vegetarian dishes like misal pav and puran poli.

Dishes.Name: Misal Pav
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy sprouted lentil curry with bread.
Steps: Cook lentils with spices.
Serve with pav and onions.

Dishes.Name: Puran Poli
Steps: Cook chana dal with jaggery.
Stuff in dough, roll, and cook.

Dishes.Name: Vada Pav
Steps: Make potato patties, fry.
Serve in pav with chutney.

Dishes.Name: Pav Bhaji
Steps: Cook and mash vegetables with spices.
Serve with buttered pav.

Dishes.Name: Kolhapuri Chicken
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Modak
Steps: Make dough with rice flour.
Fill with coconut and jaggery, steam.

Dishes.Name: Bharli Vangi
Steps: Stuff eggplants with coconut and spices.
Cook in oil until tender.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add prawns and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Sabudana Vada
Steps: Soak sabudana, mix with potatoes and peanuts.
Shape into patties, fry.

Dishes.Name: Amti
Steps: Cook dal with spices.
Add tamarind, simmer.

Rajasthan.BasicInfo: Rajasthani cuisine is robust, using millets, lentils, and dairy, with dishes like dal bati churma and ghevar.

Dishes.Name: Dal Bati Churma
Dishes.BasicInfo: Lentil curry with baked wheat balls and sweet crumble.
Steps: Bake wheat balls, cook dal with spices.
Crush some bati for churma, serve with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Laal Maas
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add mutton, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Gatte ki Sabzi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Gram flour dumplings in yogurt curry.
Steps: Make dumplings from gram flour, boil.
Cook in spiced yogurt gravy.

Dishes.Name: Ker Sangri
Dishes.BasicInfo: Dried desert beans and berries curry.
Steps: Soak ker and sangri, drain.
Sauté with spices in oil.

Dishes.Name: Ghevar
Dishes.BasicInfo: Sweet fried disc soaked in syrup.
Steps: Make batter with flour and milk.
Fry in ghee, soak in sugar syrup.

Dishes.Name: Bajra Roti
Steps: Knead bajra flour with water.
Roll and cook on griddle.

Dishes.Name: Pyaaz Kachori
Steps: Make dough, fill with spiced onions.
Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Mohanthal
Steps: Cook gram flour in ghee.
Add sugar syrup, set with nuts.

Dishes.Name: Churma Ladoo
Steps: Cook flour in ghee, mix with jaggery.
Shape into balls with nuts.

Dishes.Name: Rajasthani Kadhi
Steps: Mix yogurt and gram flour, cook with water.
Temper with spices in oil.

Tamil Nadu.BasicInfo: Tamil cuisine is known for rice-based dishes, tangy curries, and dosa, with liberal use of tamarind and coconut.

Dishes.Name: Dosa
Steps: Ferment rice and dal batter overnight.
Spread on griddle, cook until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Sambar
Steps: Cook dal and vegetables with spices.
Temper with oil and spices.

Dishes.Name: Rasam
Steps: Boil tamarind with spices and tomato.
Temper with oil and spices.

Dishes.Name: Idli
Steps: Ferment rice and dal batter overnight.
Steam in molds until fluffy.

Dishes.Name: Chettinad Chicken
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Pongal
Steps: Cook rice and dal with spices.
Temper with ghee and spices.

Dishes.Name: Kozhukattai
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed rice flour dumplings with sweet filling.
Steps: Make dough with rice flour.
Fill with coconut and jaggery, steam.

Dishes.Name: Fish Curry
Steps: Sauté spices and coconut in oil.
Add fish and tamarind, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Vada
Steps: Soak and grind dal into batter.
Shape into rings, fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Payasam
Steps: Cook vermicelli in milk.
Add sugar and cardamom, simmer.

Chandigarh.BasicInfo: Chandigarh cuisine blends Punjabi flavors with urban influences, featuring rich curries, tandoori dishes, and street food.

Dishes.Name: Butter Chicken
Steps: Marinate and grill chicken.
Cook tomato puree with spices, add cream and chicken.

Dishes.Name: Chole Bhature
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy chickpea curry with fried bread.
Steps: Cook chickpeas with spices.
Knead flour, fry bhature, serve together.

Dishes.Name: Tandoori Chicken
Steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Grill until charred.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Tikki
Steps: Mix potatoes with spices, shape into patties.
Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Pav Bhaji
Steps: Cook and mash vegetables with spices.
Serve with buttered pav.

Dishes.Name: Lassi
Steps: Blend yogurt with sugar and water.
Add cardamom, serve chilled.

Dishes.Name: Paneer Tikka
Steps: Marinate paneer with yogurt and spices.
Grill until charred.

Dishes.Name: Rajma
Steps: Cook kidney beans with spices.
Sauté onions, add beans, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Golgappa
Steps: Make puris from semolina, fry.
Fill with potatoes and spiced water.

Dishes.Name: Kulfi
Steps: Simmer milk until thickened.
Add sugar and nuts, freeze in molds.

Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu.BasicInfo: Damanese cuisine blends Gujarati, Maharashtrian, and Portuguese influences, with seafood and vegetarian dishes.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Balchao
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add prawns and vinegar, cook until thick.

Dishes.Name: Dhokla
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed fermented rice and chickpea cake.
Steps: Mix flours with yogurt, ferment overnight.
Steam batter, temper with spices.

Dishes.Name: Fish Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add fish and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Undhiyu
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add vegetables, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Pork Vindaloo
Steps: Marinate pork with spices and vinegar.
Sauté onions, add pork, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Khandvi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Rolled gram flour sheets with spices.
Steps: Cook gram flour and yogurt into a paste.
Spread thin, roll, temper with spices.

Dishes.Name: Crab Xacuti
Steps: Sauté spices and coconut in oil.
Add crab, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Pav Bhaji
Steps: Cook and mash vegetables with spices.
Serve with buttered pav buns.

Dishes.Name: Vegetable Pulao
Steps: Sauté spices and vegetables in oil.
Add rice and water, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Serradura
Steps: Mix whipped cream with condensed milk and vanilla.
Layer with crushed biscuits, chill.

Delhi.BasicInfo: Delhi cuisine is a melting pot of Mughal, Punjabi, and street food influences, known for rich curries and chaat.

Dishes.Name: Butter Chicken
Steps: Marinate and grill chicken.
Cook tomato puree with spices, add cream and chicken.

Dishes.Name: Chole Bhature
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy chickpea curry with fried bread.
Steps: Cook chickpeas with spices.
Knead flour, fry bhature, serve together.

Dishes.Name: Pani Puri
Steps: Make puris from semolina, fry.
Fill with potatoes and spiced water.

Dishes.Name: Nihari
Steps: Slow-cook mutton with spices.
Sauté onions, add to stew.

Dishes.Name: Aloo Chaat
Steps: Fry potatoes until crispy.
Toss with spices and chutney.

Dishes.Name: Biryani
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fragrant rice with meat and spices.
Steps: Marinate chicken with spices.
Layer with rice, cook until fragrant.

Dishes.Name: Paratha
Steps: Knead dough, stuff with potatoes.
Roll and cook on griddle.

Dishes.Name: Dahi Bhalla
Steps: Soak and grind dal, fry into dumplings.
Soak in yogurt, top with spices.

Dishes.Name: Shahi Paneer
Steps: Sauté spices and tomato puree.
Add paneer and cream, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Kulfi
Steps: Simmer milk until thickened.
Add sugar and nuts, freeze in molds.

Ladakh.BasicInfo: Ladakhi cuisine is simple and hearty, suited for high altitudes, with barley, meat, and dairy-based dishes.

Dishes.Name: Thukpa
Dishes.BasicInfo: Noodle soup with vegetables or meat.
Steps: Cook noodles separately.
Sauté spices and vegetables, add chicken and broth.

Dishes.Name: Momos
Dishes.BasicInfo: Steamed dumplings with meat or vegetables.
Steps: Make dough, fill with minced chicken and spices.
Steam until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Skyu
Steps: Make small pasta from flour.
Cook with vegetables and spices in broth.

Dishes.Name: Chhutagi
Dishes.BasicInfo: Bow-tie pasta with meat or vegetables.
Steps: Shape dough into bow-ties.
Cook with mutton and vegetables in broth.

Dishes.Name: Tsampa

Add butter and salt, stir until thick.

Dishes.Name: Butter Tea
Dishes.BasicInfo: Salty tea with butter and milk.
Steps: Boil tea leaves with water.
Add milk, butter, and salt, churn.

Dishes.Name: Paba
Steps: Knead barley flour into dough.
Cook with vegetables and spices.

Dishes.Name: Khambir
Steps: Knead flour with yeast and water.
Shape and bake until golden.

Dishes.Name: Yak Cheese
Steps: Heat milk, add rennet to curdle.
Press and age cheese.

Dishes.Name: Chang
Steps: Ferment barley with yeast and water.
Strain and serve chilled.

Lakshadweep.BasicInfo: Lakshadweep cuisine is seafood-centric, with coconut and rice, influenced by Malabar and Arabian flavors.

Dishes.Name: Fish Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add fish and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Tuna Fry
Steps: Marinate tuna with spices.
Fry until golden and crispy.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Rice
Dishes.BasicInfo: Fragrant rice cooked in coconut milk.
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add rice and coconut milk, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Fry
Steps: Marinate prawns with spices.
Fry until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Kadalakka
Steps: Melt jaggery with water.
Mix with coconut and cardamom, set.

Dishes.Name: Fish Cutlet
Steps: Mix fish with potatoes and spices.
Shape into patties, fry.

Dishes.Name: Crab Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add crab and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Appam
Steps: Ferment rice and coconut batter with yeast.
Cook in a curved pan until lacy.

Dishes.Name: Octopus Fry
Steps: Marinate octopus with spices.
Fry until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Chutney
Steps: Grind coconut with chili and salt.
Temper with mustard seeds in oil.

Puducherry.BasicInfo: Puducherry cuisine blends Tamil, French, and Creole influences, with seafood, rice, and unique desserts.

Dishes.Name: Prawn Curry
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add prawns and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Dosa
Steps: Ferment rice and dal batter overnight.
Spread on griddle, cook until crispy.

Dishes.Name: Fish Moilee
Dishes.BasicInfo: Mild fish curry with coconut milk.
Steps: Sauté spices in oil.
Add fish and coconut milk, simmer.

Dishes.Name: Idli
Steps: Ferment rice and dal batter overnight.
Steam in molds until fluffy.

Dishes.Name: Chicken Chettinad
Steps: Sauté onions and spices in oil.
Add chicken, cook until tender.

Dishes.Name: Sambar
Steps: Cook dal and vegetables with spices.
Temper with oil and spices.

Dishes.Name: Crab Masala
Dishes.BasicInfo: Spicy crab curry with Creole spices.
Steps: Sauté spices and coconut in oil.
Add crab, cook until done.

Dishes.Name: Pongal
Steps: Cook rice and dal with spices.
Temper with ghee and spices.

Dishes.Name: Coconut Soufflé
Dishes.BasicInfo: Light coconut dessert with French influence.
Steps: Mix coconut milk, eggs, sugar, and flour.
Bake until puffed and golden.

Dishes.Name: Rasam
Steps: Boil tamarind with spices and tomato.
Temper with oil and spices.
